required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes Study Evaluating the Zero-P PEEK
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multi-Center Clinical Outcomes Study Evaluating the Zero-P PEEK for Anterior Cervical Interbody Fusion in the Treatment of Cervical Degenerative Disc Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, prospective, outcomes study. In this study, the Zero-P PEEK implant will be used in patients undergoing ACDF for treatment of SCDD at a single level between C3 and C7. The cohort will be followed over time to twenty-four (24) months after surgery. Up to fifteen (15) sites will participate in this study. This is not a controlled study.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This study was terminated early due to lower than expected enrollment rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Neck Disability Index Scores
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who experienced a maintenance or improvement according to measures of pain and/or function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in the Neck and Arm Visual Analog Pain Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who experienced a maintenance of improvement in VAS neck pain intensity, neck pain frequency, arm pain intensity, and/or arm pain frequency.
Percentage of subjects who had an implant related complication

arm_group.description: Treatment of cervical DDD with the Zero-P device

intervention.description: The Zero-P PEEK is a stand-alone device intended for use in cervical interbody fusion. The device consists of a plate and a spacer with four rigid screws to provide similar stability to a traditional cervical plate and interbody spacer. It is intended for use in skeletally mature patients with symptomatic cervical disc disease (SCDD) with accompanying radicular symptoms, at one level from C3 to C7.

overall_official.affiliation: DePuy Synthes Assoc. Director Clinical Research

facility.name: Neurospine, South East Alabama Medical Center

It is intended for use in skeletally mature patients with symptomatic cervical disc disease (SCDD) with accompanying radicular symptoms, at one level from C3 to C7.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
